meanings.definition: A V-shaped cut or indentation in an object
meanings.sent1: She counted the notches on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden door had several notches from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel carved tiny notches on the picnic table.
meanings.sent4: Each notch on the ruler represented an inch.
meanings.sent5: The hunter kept track of his kills by carving notches on his bow.

meanings.definition: A level or degree in a scale or series
meanings.sent1: The temperature dropped a few notches overnight.
meanings.sent2: His confidence went up a notch after receiving praise.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room went up several notches when the band started playing.
meanings.sent4: Her skills in painting have reached a new notch.
meanings.sent5: The tension between the two rivals increased by a notch.

meanings.definition: To make a V-shaped cut in something
meanings.sent1: He carefully notches the wood before joining the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman notches the leather to create a decorative pattern.
meanings.sent3: She notches the paper to make it easier to tear.
meanings.sent4: The chef notches the vegetables for presentation.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter notches the edges of the shelf for stability.
